title: 90 Minute Rolls
directions: Combine 1 1/2 cups flour, sugar, salt, and undissolved yeast. Heat milk, water and margarine to 120 to 130 degrees. Add to dry ingredients, beat 2 minutes at medium speed, scraping bowl occasionally. Add 1/2 cup flour. Beat at high speed for 2 minutes. Stir in enough flour to make a soft dough. Turn onto floured board; knead 2 to 3 minutes, until smooth. Place in a greased bowl. Cover, place in a large pan of hot water (about 120 degrees). Let rise 15 minutes. Turn onto board. Divide into 24 equal pieces. Shape into smooth balls. Arrange in a greased 13x9 inch pan. Cover; place in a pan of hot water. Let rise 15 minutes. Bake at 375 degrees for 20 to 25 minutes. Yields 2 dozen rolls.

title: Alla Olla
directions: Cook and drain pasta.
Saute other ingredients
Toss pasta and sprinkle with parmesan cheese. Server with garlic bread.

title: Amazing Apple Pie
ingredients: 1/2 cup firmly packed light brown sugar
directions: Prepare your favorite pie crust. Preheat oven to 425 degrees.
Combine fruit, sugar, flour and cinnamon and lemon juice. Mix lightly. Pour into crust, top with butter slices.
For streusel, in mixing bowl combine flour, sugar and cinnamon. Cut in butter until crumbly (or use food processor). Stir in nuts, sprinkle over apple filling.
Bake in 425 degree oven for 40-45 minutes until juice is bubbly in center.

title: Ambrosia Salad
ingredients: 1 1/2 cup seedless grapes and/or sliced strawberries
directions: Drain pineapple and oranges. Combine all ingredients and chill before serving.

title: Artichoke Dip
directions: Mix all together in a bowl and put in a Pyrex ramekin that can be baked. Before baking sprinkle with some Parmesan cheese on the top. Cook approximately 15-20 minutes until bubbly. Serve with crackers.

title: Avocado Tomato Toss
ingredients: 2 medium avocados, halved and cut into chunks
directions: Whisk together first 5 ingredients in a large bowl. Add tomatoes, red onion and avocados, gently stirring to coat. Serve over shredded romaine lettuce.

title: Bacon Wrapped Water Chestnuts
directions: Wrap each water chestnut in 1/4 slice of bacon and secure with toothpick. Cover with sauce of catsup, brown sugar, Worcestershire and garlic. Cover with saran wrap and cook in microwave on high for 10 to 12 minutes. Serve warm.

title: Baked Apple Pancake
directions: Heat oven to 450 degrees.
Melt butter in 10x12 heavy oven saft skillet and saute apples until just tender.
Combine flour, salt, nutmeg, eggs, and milk in blender and beat for 2 minutes.
Immediately pour batter over sizzling butter and apples.
Bake for 12-15 minutes or until edges are puffed and brown.
Combine sugar and cinnamon and sprinkle on top.

title: Baked Chicken with Jalapeno Jelly
ingredients: 3 large tomatoes, peeled, seeded, and diced
directions: Saute onion in oil until softened. Add paprika, hot sauce, jalapenos, tomatoes, thyme, salt and pepper. Continue to cook for a couple of minutes. Add chicken making sure some of the sauce is at bottom of the pan as well as on top of the chicken. Bake, uncovered, at 375 for 45 minutes. Add chopped, fresh cilantro leaves before serving chicken. Serve with rice.

title: Banana Bread
directions: Cream butter, sugar, and eggs.
Add soda, salt and flour.
Add remaining ingredients and bake 45 minutes at 350.
Makes 1 large or 2 medium loaves.

title: Bananas Foster
directions: Peel bananas and cut in half, slice lengthwise into quarters.
In a large skillet, melt the butter over medium heat. Add sugar, cinnamon, and banana liqueur.
Cook, stirring frequently, about 2 minutes or until bubbly. Add the bananas and cook, turning once for about 2 minutes. Remove from heat. In a small saucepan, heat the rum over low heat.
Ignite the rum; pour flaming rum over the bananas and sauce. Allow flaming until it dies out, swirling gently to prolong the flaming.
Scoop ice cream into shallow dessert bowls and spoon bananas and sauce on top.

title: Basic Cheese Fondu
directions: In a medium saucepan over low heat, mix together milk, worcestershire sauce, dry mustard, garlic and flour. Heat until almost boiling. Gradually stir in cheddar cheese. Continue heating until all the cheese has melted.

title: Basic Marinade
directions: Mix all ingredients thoroughly. This is a good marinade for steak, chicken, kabobs, fajitas, ect.

title: Basil and Blue Cheese Salad
ingredients: 1/2 cup firmly packed fresh basil leaves, coarsely chopped
directions: Whisk together first 5 ingredients. Cover and chill until ready to use (up to 24 hours).
Toss together greens and basil. Top with pears, oranges, avocados, and blue cheese; toss. Drizzle with vinaigrette. Serve immediately.
It’s ideal to slice pears and avocados at the last minute so they won’t turn brown. You can do this one hour ahead of time and toss in a small amount of lemon juice.

title: Beacon Hill Cookies
ingredients: 1 cup (16 oz) Bakers semi sweet chocolate chips
directions: Melt chocolate over hot water. Beat egg whites with salt until foamy. Gradually add sugar, beating well. Then beat until stiff peaks form. Beat in vanilla and vinegar. Fold in chocolate and walnuts. Drop by the tsp on greased cookie sheets. Bake in moderate oven 350 for 10 minutes. Remove immediately. 36 cookies

title: Beef Stroganoff
directions: Brown beef and onion. Drain grease. Add remaining ingredients except sour cream and simmer. Add sour cream and heat through. Server over boiled egg noodles or rice.

title: Black Bean Enchiladas
directions: Cover bottom of a 9x13 pan with salsa. Dip both sides of tortilla in salsa and fill with chicken, beans, cheese mixture. Fold and repeat until pan is full. Cover with remaining salsa and cheese. Cover with foil and bake 30-40 minutes at 350.

title: Boeuf Bourguignonne
ingredients: 3 pounds rump of beef, cut into chunks
directions: Fry bacon in 5-6 quart casserole until crisp. Remove and set aside. Dry beef chunks on absorbent paper. Dredge with flour and fry in bacon fat, adding a little butter if necessary, until well browned on all sides. Remove meat as it browns and place it with bacon. Brown carrots and onions in the fate. Add bacon and meat and season to taste. Add wine, stock, garlic, bay leaf, thyme and tomato paste. Cover casserole and cook in 325 oven 3-4 hours or until meat is fork tender. Meantime, saute mushrooms in butter for 5 minutes. Add with drained onions to casserole. Sprinkle with parsley before serving. Serves 6-8.

title: Bok Choy Salad
ingredients: 2 packages Ramen noodles crushed (do not use flavoring)
directions: Brown almonds, ramen noodles, sesame seeds and margarine in skillet and set aside to cool.
Cut lettuce.
Toss with dressing:
1 cup vegetable oil, 1/4 cup vinegar, 1 cup sugar, 2 TBSP soy sauce.
Top with crunchy mixture.

title: Bran Muffins
ingredients: 5 tsp baking soda, sift this into flour to remove any lumps
directions: Pour boiling water over bran in large bowl. Add shortening. Stir until shortening is melted and let cool. Add other ingredients. Stir to mix well. Use immediately or cover and put in refrigerator and bake as desired. Batter will keep in refrigerator up to two weeks.
Drop by spoonfuls into well greased muffin tins. Bake at 400 degrees for about 10 minutes. Test with a toothpick for doneness.

title: Bran Muffins
ingredients: 15 oz box Rasin Bran Flakes (7 cups)
directions: Stir flour, soda, salt and bran flakes together.
Mix sugar, eggs, oil, buttermilk into dry ingredients just until combined.
Keep batter chilled in an airtight container for up to six weeks.
Spoon 1/4 cup batter into well buttered or paper lined muffin cups.
Bake at 375 for 15-20 minutes.

title: Bread and Cheese Puff
ingredients: 12 to 14 slices white bread, crusts removed
directions: Butter both sides of bread, cube. Place 1/2 of them in bottom of 9x13 pan. Spread cheese on top of bread. Add meat. Put other 1/2 of bread on top. Mix together remaining ingredients and pour over casserole. Bake at 350 for 45 minutes.

title: Breakfast Hot Dish
directions: Place croutons and cheese in a greased 9x13 pan. Cook sausage in pan until dark brown. Drain on paper towel and place on top of croutons and cheese. Mix together remaining ingredients and pour over other ingredients in baking dish. Bake at 200 for 1 1/2 hours. May be refrigerated overnight.

title: Broccoli Cheese Soup
ingredients: 2 quart fat free half and half
directions: Cook broccoli according to package directions and drain. Make roux of flour and margarine over medium heat, stirring constantly with wire whisk. Cook until well blended and bubbly. Slowly whisk in half and half. Add broccoli, broth, and cheese to above sauce and heat through until cheese well melted and soup warm. Can make ahead of time and refrigerate or freeze.

title: Brownie Cookies
directions: Melt shortening in saucepan. Allow to cool slightly. Blend in sugar, then beat in eggs one at a time. Add vanilla. Mix cocoa, flour and salt in a small bowl and then blend into above mixture. Add nuts. Chill in refrigerator for about 1 hour. Shape dough into 1 inch balls. Roll in powdered sugar. Bake for 10 minutes in 350 degree oven. Makes 3 to 4 dozen

title: Cafe Rio Recipes
ingredients: 1 tbsp. garlic powder, pinch of salt
Cook all ingredients per rice directions, substituting chicken broth for water. When rice is done add 1/2 to 1 cup chopped cilantro, 1 TBS fresh lime juice and 1 cup green enchilada sauce.
Cook in crockpot all day. 1 hour before serving, remove roast and shred it. Dump out cooking juices.Put shredded pork back into crock pot, add 1 cup dark brown sugar & 1 cup red enchilada sauce.
1 tsp cumin, 2 tbsp oil, 1/2 tsp salt
Heat oil, cumin and garlic. Add rest and warm.
3 tomatillos, peeled and cute into fourths
Mix well in a blender and refrigerate for 1 hour.

title: Candied Pecan Salad
directions: Sprinkle pecans with white sugar, vanilla, cinnamon, karo syrup. Stir to coat. Bake on cookie sheet at 350 for 10 minutes. Remove immediately onto wax paper to cool.

title: Carmel Pecan Pumpkin Bread Puddings
ingredients: 1 (12 oz) French bread loaf, cut into 1 inch pieces (about 10 cups)
1 cup firmly packed light brown sugar
directions: __SECTION__Carmel Pecan Sauce
Prepare bread puddings: Whisk together eggs and next 8 ingredients in a large bowl until well blended. Add bread pieces, stirring to thoroughly coat. Cover with plastic wrap, and chill 8 to 24 hours.
Preheat oven to 350. Spoon bread mixture into 11 6 oz lightly greased ramekins. Ramekins will be completely full, and mixture will mound slightly. Place on an aluminum foil lined jelly roll pan.
Bake at 350 for 50 minutes, shielding with foil after 30 minutes.
During last 15 minutes of baking prepare Carmel Pecan Sauce. Remove bread puddings from oven’ drizzle with Carmel-Pecan Sauce. Bake 5 minutes or until sauce is thoroughly heated and begins to bubble.

title: Carmels
directions: Cook sugar, karo, butter and 1/2 cup cream. Stir until boils and then add the rest of the cream slowly so that candy does not stop boiling.
Stir occasionally until 245 degrees.
Stir in vanilla and pour into buttered cake pan.

title: Cheddar Scallion Drop Biscuits
ingredients: 6 Tbs cold unsalted butter, cut into 1/2 inch cubes
directions: Preheat oven to 450

Whisk together flour, baking powder, sugar, baking soda, and salt in a bowl. Grate the butter, using the largest holes on a box grater over the flour mixture. Using your finger tips, gently incorporate the butter into the mixture. Stir in the cheddar and scallions. Use a fork to stir in the buttermilk until just combined.
Drop dough in 12 equal mounds about 2 inches apart onto a buttered large baking sheet. Bake in middle of oven until golden, 18-20 minutes.

title: Cheese Ball
directions: Add all ingredients and let harden some in fridge. Then roll in chopped pecans. Serve with crackers.

title: Cheese Cake
directions: Line spring pan with graham cracker mixture (graham crackers, 3 tbsp. sugar, 1/3 cup melted butter).
Beat cream cheese, 1 cup sugar, and eggs well and pour into crust. Bake 35-45 minutes at 350. Cool for 20 minutes.
Mix sour cream, 1/2 cup sugar and 2 tsp vanilla. Pour on top of cooled cake. Bake for 10 more minutes and refrigerate 1 hour before cutting.

title: Cheese Stuffed Manicotti
directions: Cook manicotti according to directions. Combine cheeses. Stir in eggs, parsley, onion and water. Pour 2/3 cup of spaghetti sauce into bottom of baking dish. Stuff manicotti with cheese mixture and place in pan. Pour remaining sauce over manicotti. Sprinkle with mozzarella. Bake uncovered at 350 until bubbly. May add cooked hamburger to sauce mixture for you carnivores!

title: Cheesy Chicken and Potatoes
ingredients: 2 to 3 lbs chicken pieces or breasts
directions: Slice potatoes on bottom of baking dish and arrange chicken on top. Tuck onions around chicken and spread mixture of soup and cheese on top. Bake at 350 degrees for 1 1/2 hours.

title: Cheesy Penne Pasta with Pepper
directions: Saute onion, garlic, and peppers. Add soup, cheese and chicken. Cook until cheese melted. Mix with pasta and serve.

title: Chicken & Dried Beef Casserole
ingredients: 4 oz dried sliced beef in a jar
directions: Soak beef in water for 10 minutes to remove salt. Roll chicken breasts slightly and wrap bacon around each roll. Line baking dish with dried beef and layer chicken rolls on top. Mix soup and sour cream. Spread on top and sprinkle with paprika Cook 2 1/2 hours at 275 and serve with rice or noodles.

title: Chicken Dijon
ingredients: 1 medium red bell pepper, cut into thin strips
directions: Sprinkle chicken with salt and pepper. Melt butter in large skillet over medium high heat; add chicken and cook 3-4 minutes on each side or until golden brown. Remove chicken from skillet; add bell pepper and onion and cook, stirring often, 4-5 minutes or until vegetables are tender. Return chicken to skillet Whisk together broth, flour, and mustard and poor over chicken. Cover, reduce heat to low and simmer 20 minutes or until chicken is done.

title: Chicken Noodle Soup
ingredients: Boil the following in large soup pot:
Several pieces of chicken (wings, thighs or breasts...whatever you have)
Cover well with water bring to a boil and then turn down heat and simmer with lid on for 45 min. Next, remove chicken from broth and let cool so you can take meat off bone and chop when cooled.
directions: Put flour in bowl; make a well in center and put lightly beaten eggs and salt in center. Mix eggs into flour with spoon, using hands as necessary. Add water 1 tbsp at a time mixing thoroughly after each addition. Add only enought water to form dough into a ball. Turn dough onto well floured board/pastry cloth and knead until dough is smooth and elastic. Lest rest 10 min. Divide dough in half and roll each half out until thin. Cut dough with sharp knife into noodles.

Put chicken back into broth. Season broth with salt and pepper to taste. Sometimes I mix 1/2 cup of milk with 1-2 tbsp flour (whisked together and add to broth....you don’t have to). Bring broth back to a boil and drop noodles in cooking about 10-12 minutes until noodles done.

title: Chicken Rice-a-Roni Casserole
directions: Prepare Rice-a-Roni as directed on box. Mix in chilies, chicken, and sour cream. Top with cheese and bake at 350 for 30-45 minutes.

title: Chicken Roll Ups
directions: __SECTION__Gravy
In a small pan sauté celery and onion in butter. Then add to cream cheese that has been softened.
Unroll crescent rolls and flatten slightly. Put about 2 Tbs of chicken mixture in each roll. Roll up starting from the fat end and tuck roll in as you go.
Roll in melted butter and bread crumbs. Bake at 375 for 15-20 minutes.

title: Chicken Satay with Peanut Sauce
ingredients: 1 pound boneless and skinless chicken breasts
1/3 cup unsweetened coconut milk, chicken stock or water
1 to 3 Tbs fresh lime or lemon juice
1 Tbs fish sauce or soy sauce
directions: __SECTION__Chicken

Cut chicken into strips 1 inch wide, 4 inches long and not more then 1/4 inch thick. Combine the turmeric, salt and coconut milk and marinate the chicken in this mixture. Prepare the peanut sauce. Soak the skewers in cold water. Thread chicken strips onto the skewers and cook on a preheated grill or under the broiler. You can also just cook the chicken strips if you don’t want to skewer them. Serve the satay with the peanut sauce on the side to dip in.

title: Chicken Tacos
ingredients: In saucepan, cook onion in butter till tender but not brown.
Stir in chicken, taco sauce, salt and garlic salt.
Simmer over low heat for 15 minutes.
Warm taco shells or use soft tortillas.
Spoon chicken mixtures, sour cream and cilantro onto shells.

title: Chicken Tortilla Soup
directions: Cook chicken, beans, tomatoes, salsa and tomato sauce in crock pot on low for 8 hours. Shred chicken and top with tortilla chips and cheese.

title: Chicken and Green Chili Enchiladas
ingredients: 2 cups shredded Mexican four cheese blend, divided
directions: __SECTION__Onion and Garlic Mixture
Preheat oven to 425. Stir together first 4 ingredients, 1 1/2 cups enchilada sauce and 1 cups enchilada sauce and 1 cup cheese.

Spoon about 1/2 cups chicken mixture down center of each tortilla, roll and place seam side down in a lightly greased 13x9 pan. Pour remaining enchilada sauce over tortillas. Sprinkle with remaining 1 cup cheese.
Bake covered at 425 for 20 minutes, uncover and bake 10 minutes or until cheese is melted and golden brown.

title: Chicken and WIld Rice Soup
ingredients: 1 6.25 oz box quick cooking wild rice mix
directions: In a large pot combine 9 cups chicken broth (reserve 1 cup for later) carrots, celery, and onion. Bring to a boil.
Reduce heat, cover and simmer for 15 minutes.
Add rice and seasoning packet and cook for 5 minutes.
In a small bowl stir together 1 cup warm reserved broth, flour, salt, and pepper until smooth.
Add the flour mixture slowly to the soup pot stirring constantly with whisk.
Bring to boil, cook 1 minute or until thickened and bubbly.
Add chopped chicken.
Slowly ad half and half to soup, stirring constantly.
Heat through.

title: Chili Cheese Cubes
ingredients: 2 (4 oz) cans of mild chopped green chilies
directions: Beat eggs until light (about 4-5 minutes). Stir in dry ingredients and beat well. Fold in cheeses and chilies. Pour into greased 9x9x2 baking dish. Bake at 350 degrees for 30 to 40 minutes. Remove and let stand 10 minutes. Cut into small squares and serve hot. Or bake in mini cupcake tins. Yields 3 to 4 dozen squares.

title: Chili Potatoes
ingredients: Salt and freshly ground black pepper to taste
directions: Set oven rack in upper third of oven, preheat to 450. Lightly oil a baking sheet or coat with nonstick spray.
Cut each potato lengthwise into 8 wedges. Place potatoes in a large bowl and toss with oil, paprika, chili, salt and pepper.
Spread potatoes on the prepared baking sheet and roast for 20 minutes. Loosen and turn, roast for 10 to 15 minutes longer or until golden brown. Serve immediately.

title: Chili’s Boneless Buffalo Wings
directions: Combine flour, salt, peppers, and paprika. In another small bowl whisk together egg and milk. Slice chicken into strips or pieces. Preheat oil in deep fryer. Dip chicken into egg mixture and then flour mixture. Repeat process so chicken is well breaded. Chill on a plate for 15 minutes. Fry chicken when done resting. Combine margarine and hot suace. Place chicken in large container, pour sauce over and place lid on container and shake until chicken is well coated with sauce. Serve with blue cheese or other dipping sauces.

title: Chinese Chicken Salad
directions: Mix lettuce, onions, chicken, and almonds. Add pineapple and Chinese noodles just prior to serving. Mix with dressing.

title: Chipotle Chili Ketchup
ingredients: 2 large red bell peppers, seeded and diced
1/4 cup firmly packed chipotle chili in adobo, chilies and sauce included
directions: Heat canola oil in a 4 quart heavy saucepan over medium high heat.
When oil is hot add the bell peppers, onions, garlic and tomatoes.
Cook stirring often, until vegetables are very wilted, about 25 minutes.
Add vinegar and sugar and cook, stirring often until sugar has dissolved and liquid is reduced, about 25 minutes.
Transfer mixture to a blender.
Add chipotle chilies and adobo sauce.
Puree until smooth.
Return to heat and simmer mixture gently for about 30 minutes or until thickened and deep red in color.
Refrigerate.

title: Chocolate Chip Coconut Cookies
ingredients: 1 cup butter or margarine at room temperature
3/4 to 1 cup fine flaked sweetened coconut
directions: Preheat oven to 375. Stir flour with baking soda and salt; set aside. In large mixer bowl, cream butter with sugar, brown sugar, eggs, and vanilla. Gradually blend dry mixture into creamed mixture. Stir in nuts, coconut and chocolate chips. Drop by tablespoon one ungreased cookie sheets. Bake at 375 for 9-11 minutes or until golden brown.
*Coconut can be put in the food processor to chop it up even finer if desired.
*For chocolate chips you can use Ghirardelli Semi Sweet or the mini m&m’s.

title: Chocolate Cream Pie
directions: Bake pie shell.
Stir together sugar, cornstarch, and salt in saucepan. Blen milk and egg yolks. Gradually stir into sugar mixture.
Cook over medium heat, stirring constantly with wire whisk until mixture thickens and boils. Boil and stir for 1 minute. Remove from heat. Blend in chocolate and vanilla.
Immediately pour into baked pie shell. Cover with saran wrap, pressing the plastic onto the filling gently.
Chill pie thoroughly, at least 2 hours.
Serve with sweetened whip cream. Can make chocolate curls with vegetable peeler from hershey bar for added garnish.

title: Chocolate Mousse
ingredients: 1 package (4 serving size) Jell-O Chocolate Flavor Fat Free Sugar Free Instant Reduced Calorie Pudding and Pie Filling
2 cups thawed Cool Whip Free Whipped Topping
directions: Pour milk into medium bowl. Add pudding mix. Beat with wire whisk for 1 minutes. Gently stir in 1 1/2 cups whipped topping. Spoon into 6 dessert dishes. Refrigerate until ready to serve. Just before serving, garnish with remaining whipped topping and raspberries. Store leftover dessert in the refrigerator.

title: Chocolate Roll Up
directions: __SECTION__Cake

Beat eggs until thick and lemon colored. Gradually add sugar and vanilla. Sift cocoa, flour and salt together, then sift over egg mixture, fold in, spread batter evenly in a cookie sheet with edges. Bake at 375 degrees for 10 minutes or until it is light and springs back when touched. After baked, loosen edges and immediately turn upside down on a towel. Sprinkle with confectioners sugar and cut away dry edges. While cake is still warm, roll cake and towel from long end. Cool on wire rack. Unroll and spread soft ice cream over cake and roll up. Refreeze. Frost with a fudge topping, then freeze before serving.

title: Chocolate Souffle
directions: Blend sugar and cornstarch in small saucepan. Gradually stir in milk; add chocolate. Cook over medium heat, stiring constantly, until chocolate is melted and mixture thickens and boils. Boil and stir 1 minute.
In small mixer bowl, beat egg yolks until very thick and lemon colored. Gradually beat in chocolate mixture. Stir in butter and vanilla. Cool to room temperature.

Heat over to 350 degrees. Butter and sugar a 6 cup souffle dish. make 4 inch band of triple thickness aluminum foil 2 inches longer then circumfrance of dish, butter one side and sprinkle with sugar. Extend depth of dish by securing foil band, butter side in, around top of dish.

In large mixer bowl, beat egg whites, salt, and cream of tarter just until stiff peaks form. Stir about 1/4 of egg whites into chocolate mixture. Gently fold in remaining whites. Carefully pour into dish.

Bake 50 minutes or until knife inserted halfway between center and edge comes out clean. Serve immediately. Carefully remove foil band and divide souffle into sections with 2 forks. If desired, serve with sweetened whipped cream and berries.

title: Christmas Nuggets
directions: Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Cream butter, sift and measure confectioners sugar, add butter and cream well. Add vanilla and cream well again. Sift flour and measure. With wooden spoon gradually add flour and blend well. Add nuts and blend in. Shape into 3/4 inch balls, rolling in palms of hands. Place 1/2 inch apart on an ungreased cookie sheet. Bake at 350 degrees for 30 minutes.

title: Classic Creme Caramel
directions: Preheat oven to 325.

Combine 1/3 cup sugar and 3 Tbs water in a small, heavy saucepan over medium high heat; cook until sugar dissolves, stirring frequently. Continue cooking an additional 4 minutes or until golden. Immediately pour in 6 6 oz. ramekins or custard cups coated with cooking spray, tilting each cup quickly until caramelized sugar coats bottom of cup. Set aside.

Beat eggs and egg white in a medium bowl with a whisk. Stir in milk, vanilla, 2/3 cup sugar, and salt. Divide the mixture evenly among prepared custard cups. Place cups in a 13x9 inch baking pan and add hot water to pan to a depth of 1 inch. Bake at 325 for 50 minutes or until a knife inserted in center comes out clean. Remove cups from pan. Cover and chill at least 4 hours.

Loosen edges of custard cups with a knife of rubber spatula. Place a dessert plate upside down on top of each cup; invert onto plates. Drizzle any remaining caramelized syrup over custards. Garnish with raspberries if desired.

title: Corn Bread
directions: Cream together margarine, sugar, and eggs. Add soda and buttermilk. Add cornmeal, flour and salt last and mix well with an electric beater. Pour into an 8" pan. Bake o 375 for 30 minutes. Can add chopped jalapenos for a spicy version.

title: Cranberry Pie
directions: Preheat oven to 325 degrees. Butter 10 inch pie pan. Place cranberries, walnuts and 1/2 cup sugar in bottom of pan. Beat eggs and remainder of sugar. Add the rest of ingredients until smooth. Spoon batter on top of cranberries. Bake 1 hour.

title: Cranberry Salad
ingredients: 2 cups cool whip or whipped cream
directions: Pour sugar over cranberries and let set overnight.
Add pineapple and marshmallows, let sit 4 to 8 hours.
Fold in Cool Whip or whipped cream and pour into mold (or you can just use a bowl).
You can add red grapes if desired.

title: Cranberry Swirl Coffeecake
directions: Grease and flour 10 inch tube pan. Cream together butter and sugar. Add eggs and almond extract, beat well. Sift together dry ingredients. Add alternately to butter mixture with sour cream.
Spoon half the batter into tube pan. Spread with cranberry sauce and sprinkle with chopped walnuts. Add remaining batter. Using a knife, swirl the cranberries through the batter.
Bake at 350 degrees for 24-55 minutes. Let cool.
Prepare glaze: mix sugar with water until smooth, then flavor with almond extract.

title: Cream Puffs
directions: Bring water, salt, and margarine to boil. Add flour all at once. Remove from heat. Beat. Add 4 eggs one at a time to mixture. Beat well after each addition. Drop by the teaspoon onto cold, ungreased baking sheet. bake 30 minutes at 450. Cool away from draft and cut in half.

title: Creamy Spinach Tortellini
ingredients: 1 (10 ounce) package frozen chopped spinach, thawed and drained
directions: Cook tortellini according to package directions.
Heat butter in a large skillet over medium heat. Stir in onion; cook until soft and translucent. Mix in cream cheese, parmesan, milk, mushrooms, and spinach.
Gently mix in tortellini and cherry tomatoes with skillet contents; warm through, and serve.

title: Creamy White Chili
directions: Saute chicken, onion and garlic powder

in oil. Add beans, broth, chilies, and seasonings. Bring to a boil, reduce heat and simmer uncovered for 30 minutes. Remove from heat, addsour cream and whipping cream. Be careful because this soup is stronger the next day because of the cayenne pepper.

title: Crepe Batter
directions: Stir together flour and salt. Blend together eggs, butter and milk. Add all at once to flour mixture, beating until smooth. For better absorption of flour, allow batter to stand at room temperature for 1 hour.
Blender method: Place eggs, milk, and butter in blender; add flour and salt. Blend about 1 minute or until ingredients are combined.
For use, pour half of batter onto large dinner plate.

title: Crescent Rolls
directions: Rise for 11 1/2 hours, roll, rise for 1 hour. Bake at 400 degrees for 12-15 minutes

title: Crockpot Chicken and Rice
directions: Put rice, water and chicken in crockpot. Place slices of cheese on top. Melt butter and stuffing together and pour over chicken. Cook on low for several hours.

title: Crockpot Chili
ingredients: 2 lbs ground beef (I used organic grass fed beef, but this can also be replaced with ground turkey)
directions: Chop the onion and mince the garlic.
Brown the ground beef with the onion and the garlic until no pink remains.

Put browned meat with other ingredients into crockpot or slow cooker, give it a good stir, and leave to cook on low for8-9 hours or high for 4-6. (I think it’s better when it’s cooked on low, and even better if you eat it the next day).
Serve to your Super Bowl watchers topped with an option of sour cream, shredded cheddar cheese, chopped cilantro, diced onions and crumbled tortilla chips.

title: Crockpot Orange Chicken
ingredients: 2 large carrots, peeled and sliced about 1/2-inch thick
2 large red or green bell peppers, cut into 1/2-inch chunks
4 boneless skinless chicken breast halves (about 2 pounds)
directions: Put carrots, bell peppers, garlic, then the chicken, ginger, salt, pepper and frozen orange juice in crock pot. Cover and cook on LOW 4 to 6 hours. Serve chicken on hot cooked rice on platter. Top with orange segments and green onions. Serve chicken liquid in gravy boat, if desired.
Yield: approximately 4 servings
Rachael’s Recipe Notes:
I like to use about 3 tsp. fresh ginger, finely minced, but if you don’t have fresh, use the ground. If you don’t like ginger, leave it out.
Thicken up the sauce with a cornstarch slurry (2 Tbsp. water + 1 Tbsp. cornstarch; mix until cornstarch is completely dissolved. Mix into sauce and let sit for a minute).
I like to make some stir fry Chinese veggies to go with this. I use baby bok choy, baby corn, water chestnuts, bamboo shoots and broccoli.

title: Dill Pickles
ingredients: Select freshly picked, small cucumbers about 3 inches long Let cucumbers stand in cold water overnight. Place cucumbers in sterilized jars and add the other ingredients.

Heat to boiling point. Add 1 stick of dill and 1 clove of garlic to each jar and pour vinegar solution over. Pack the cucumbers in tight and make sure the brine is covering the pickles and that there are no air bubbles.

title: Double Chocolate Cake
directions: __SECTION__Raspberry Puree
Mix all of the above ingredients with electric mixer until well blended, approximately 2 minutes. Bake in a bundt pan coated with Pam at 350 for 40-45 minutes.
Or can be baked in mini bundt cake pans for 20 to 25 minutes. These can be made ahead of time and frozen.
When cooled sprinkle with powdered sugar.

Serving suggestion: Drizzle serving plate with raspberry puree, place cake on plate, and serve with mini scoops of ice cream. Mint chocolate chip looks great for Christmas. You can make all of the ice cream scoops ahead of time putting scoops on cookie sheet lined with waxed paper. Refreeze until scoops are solid and then store in Tupperware with wax paper between layers of scoops.

title: Double Chocolate Cheesecake
ingredients: Combine crumbs and butter and press onto bottom of 9 inch spring form pan.
directions: Prepare crust. Heat oven to 450 degrees.

Combine cream cheese, sugar, and flour. Beat on medium speed of mixer until well blended. Beat in cocoa, sour cream, vanilla and almond extract until blended. Add eggs, beat one at a time, beating on low speed just until blended. Pour int crust.

Bake 10 minutes. Reduce oven temperature to 250 degrees; continue baking for 40 minutes. Remove from oven to wire rack. With knife, loosen cake from side of pan. Cool completely; remove side of pan. Refrigerate several hours before serving. Garnish with whipped cream. Store covered in refrigerator.

title: English Toffee
directions: Melt butter and sugar and stir constantly. Cook until color of coffee with cream in it over medium high heat (about 7 minutes). Stir in almonds. Put in a 10x10 pan. Cover with Hershey’s. melt and spread. Cover with shopped walnuts, pat in. Cool several hours then break apart to serve.

title: Favorite Pancakes
directions: Beat egg; add remaining ingredients in order listed and beat with rotary beater until smooth. Grease heated griddle if necessary. To test griddle, sprinkle with few drops of water. If bubbles, skitter around, heat is just right.

Pour batter from tip of large spoon or from pitcher onto hot griddle. Turn pancakes as soon as they are puffed and full of bubbles but before bubbles break. Bake other side until golden brown. Ten 4 inch pancakes

title: Five Cup Fruit Salad
directions: Mix and chill for several hours before serving.

title: French Breakfast Puffs
directions: Mix together ingredients. Grease muffin tins. Fill cups 2/3 full. Bake at 350 degrees for 20 to 25 minutes or until golden. Roll in butter then sugar and cinnamon mixed.

title: French Cookies
ingredients: 1 tsp soda dissolved in 1 cup hot water
directions: Mix all ingredients well. Bake in large cookie pan at 350 degrees for 25 minutes. Add glaze while cookies still warm and cut into bars.
Glaze: 1 1/2 cups powdered sugar, add drops of water until smooth.

title: French Mustard Pickles
ingredients: 2 quarts vinegar (1/3 water if very strong)
directions: Put cucumbers in a brine of 1/4 cup salt to each quart of boiling water and leave for 4 days. Remove from brine and soak overnight in warm water. Peel onions and break up cauliflower and soak overnight in salty water.

Cook cucumbers, onions, and cauliflower separately until tender. Make syrup. Put vinegar in large kettle. Make paste of dry ingredients, combined with a small amount of the vinegar and add to hot vinegar, stirring constantly. Add cucumbers, onions, and cauliflower to syrup. Bring to boil. Bottle in hot sterilized jars.

title: French Toast Casserole
ingredients: One loaf of cinnamon swirl bread
directions: Cube the bread and place in a 13/9 inch greased pan. Pour the egg and milk mixture over the top, the melted butter and extra cinnamon. Bake 45 minutes to 1 hour at 350. Drizzle maple syrup over the top. This can be made the night before and refrigerated.

title: Fresh Lime Cookies
ingredients: 2 Tbs sugar mixed with 2 tsp grated lime rind
directions: Cream butter and sugar until light and fluffy. Beat in salt and lime juice. Add flour. Stir with a wooden spoon until blended. Chill until firm enough to handle. Shape into two 4 inch long rolls. Wrap in plastic. Chill overnight. Heat oven to 375 degrees. Removed roll from refrigerator; cut crosswise into thin (1/8") slices; place on ungreased cookie sheet. Sprinkle with sugar and lime rind mixture. Repeat with second roll. Bake 6-8 minutes, until bottoms are golden. Remove to wire rack to cool completely.

title: Fruit Dip
ingredients: 8 oz container of low fat cool whip
directions: Thaw cool whip.
Drain pineapple.
Mix all four ingredients together.
Serve with cut up fruit.

title: Fudge
directions: Mix butter, walnuts, vanilla and chocolate chips in a bowl.
In a saucepan, mix together sugar and evaporated milk. Bring to a rolling boil and boil for 6 minutes. Pour over ingredients in bowel. Pour into pan and let set. Cut into pieces once cool and set.

title: German Pancakes
directions: Whip ingredients together.
Pour into a greased pan.
Spoon butter on top and bake 15 minutes at 450.

title: Golden Crescents
directions: Dissolve yeast in warm water. Stir in sugar, salt, eggs, shortening and 2 cups of the flour. Beat until smooth. Mix in remaining flour until smooth. Scrape dough from side of bowl. Cover; let rise in warm place until double, about 1 1/2 hours.

Divide dough in half; roll each half into 12 inch circle. Spread with butter; cut into 16 wedges. Roll up each wedge, beginning at rounded edge. Place rolls with point under, on greased baking sheet. Cover; let rise until double, about 1 hour.
Heat oven to 400 degrees. Bake 12 to 15 minutes or until golden brown. Brush rolls with butter.
Makes 32 rolls.

title: Grandma Davenport’s BBQ Hamburger
directions: Cook meat and drain, put bake in pan. Add flour, stir together rest of ingredients and pour over meat. mix and heat until warm. Serve on hamburger buns.

title: Grandma Davenport’s Sugar Cookies
directions: Cream sugar and shortening. Add vanilla and well beaten eggs. Blend in flour, baking powder, and salt. This makes a soft dough. Set for a few hours before rolling out. Roll out, cut into desired shape and bake. Makes approximately 3 dozen cookies. Be careful not to overcook!

title: Grandma Liebst’s Bread Stuffing
directions: Lay bread out and let stand over night. Break into pieces and add onions, celery, carrots. Pour melted butter over and add salt and lemon pepper to taste. Bake until done.

title: Grandma Prosek’s Christmas Hearts
directions: Grind almonds and chocolate through food grinder. Mix with sugar, cinnamon, flour and stiffly beaten egg whites. Work mixture hard with hands until it holds together. Roll dough 1/4 inch thick on sugar covered breadboard. Cut out hearts and place on sugar covered cookie sheets. Let stang at least 3 hours to dry (or overnight). Bake 15-20 minutes at 275. makes 3 1/2 -4 dozen cookies.

title: Grandma Prosek’s Turkey Gravy
directions: To make broth boil turkey neck in 5-6 cups water with celery, onion, carrots. Strain all out of broth prior to making gravy.
Make paste/roux with butter and flour, blending constantly with wire whisk. Add salt and pepper. Add 4 cups boiling broth gradually while whisking constantly.

title: Greek Salad
ingredients: 1 red onion, thinly sliced in rings
2 small green bell peppers, thinly sliced
directions: Mix dressing. Toss with salad.

title: Green Chili Stew
ingredients: 4 C chopped fresh tomatoes, without skin
directions: Brown chicken in olive oil. Add onion and garlic. Add 1/2 cup flour. Cook 1 to 2 minutes and remove from heat.
Add remaining ingredients and cook 1 to 1 1/2 hours on low heat or until potatoes are tender.
Serve with flour tortillas and lots of liquids!

title: Ham and Cheese Breakfast Casserole
directions: Butter bread and put in a glass 9x13 pan. Layer half of cheese and ham ontop. Put more bread down and the reet of the ham and cheese. Mix milk, eggs, and dry ingredients. Pour over the layers. Sprinkle with cheese and bake fro 40 minutes at 350.

title: Ham and Swiss Croissants
directions: Mix mustard, poppy seeds and onion.
Spread on croissants.
Add ham and cheese slices.
Wrap in foil and bake at 325 for 15 minutes.

title: Holiday Wassail
directions: Combine all ingredients in a large pot and boil. Reduce heat to simmer and serve warm.

title: Holly’s Fresh Salsa
directions: Bend tomatoes, vinegar, garlic powder, salt, oregano, and basil in blender. Then stir in remaining ingredients. Add more red pepper to spice it up or less for a milder salsa. Grab a bag of chips and enjoy!

title: Hot Chocolate Mix
directions: Blend ingredients together. Stir 2 Tbs of mixture into hot water or milk.

title: Hot Sesame Green Beans
directions: Toast the sesame seeds in a dry skillet over medium heat, tossing frequently until golden. Cook the beans in 2 inches of boiled salted water for 2 to 3 minutes. Drain well.

Heat the vegetable oil in a large nonstick skillet until the oil shimmers and smokes. Add the beans and stir fry for 5 minutes, until they begin to caramelize and brown at the edges. Add the crushed red pepper, sesame oil, coarse salt and toasted sesame seeds. Toss a minute more. Remove from the heat and serve.

title: Ida’s Best Loved Cinnamon Rolls
ingredients: 4 - 5 more cups of flour (total 12-14 cups of flour for entire recipe)
directions: Mix yeast, warm water, 3 cups flour and sugar and let sit for 15 minutes.
Add oil, eggs, vanilla, salt and 5 cups of flour. Mix for 5 minutes and let rest for 5 minutes.Add 4-5 more cups flour. Let rest for 5 minutes.
Divide dough into half or thirds and roll each portion out 1/4 inch thick. Spread melted butter over dough.
Sprinkle dough with dark brown sugar.
Roll up dough tightly and cut into rolls.
Place each roll on greased jelly roll pan. Press down gently on each roll to make uniformed height.
Place larger rolls on corners of pan. Leave 1 1/2 inch boarder from edge of pan and don’t let rolls touch each other.
Cover with towel and let rise until double.
Bake at 350 for 20-25 minutes. Secret is to not over bake! Bake only until light brown.

title: Iranian Pomegranate Granita
directions: Mix all ingredients until sugar is dissolved. Pour into wide and shallow glass or nonreactive pan and place in freezer for one hour. Using a spoon, break up the granita in the pan and replace in freezer. Repeat until all the juice has formed into ice crystals.

title: Lasagna
directions: Brown beef and sausage. Drain fat and add tomatoes and tomato sauce. Simmer. In a separate bowl mix remaining ingredients. Layer lasagna noodles, meat sauce and cheese mixture. Sprinkle with mozzarella cheese and bake 30-45 minutes at 375.

title: Lasagna
ingredients: 3 cups (two 12 oz cartons) creamed cottage cheese
1 package (8 oz) lasagna noodles, cooked and well drained
directions: Cook and stir ground beef, ground pork, onion and garlic in large saucepan until meat is brown and onion is tender. Drain off fat. Add tomatoes and break up with fork. Stir in tomato sauce, 2 Tbs parsley flakes, sugar, 1 tsp salt and basil. Heat to boiling, stirring occasionally. Reduce heat; simmer uncovered 1 hour or until mixture is the consistency of spaghetti sauce. Heat oven to 350 degrees. Mix cottage cheese, 1/2 cup Parmesan cheese, 1 Tbs parsley flakes, 1 1/2 tsp salt and the oregano. Reserve 1/2 cup meat sauce for thin top layer. In ungreased baking pan, 12x9x2 inches, layer 1/4 each of the noodles, remaining meat sauce, the cheese mixture; repeat 3 times. Spread reserved meat sauce over top; sprinkle with 1/2 cup Parmesan cheese. If desired, lasagna can be covered and refrigerated several hours at this point. Bake uncovered 45 minutes. Allow an additional 10 to 15 minutes if lasagna has been refrigerated. For easier cutting, let stand 15 minutes after removing from oven.

title: Leek, Potato & Gruyere Frittata
ingredients: 6 oz. small red potatoes, sliced 1/8" thick
Salt and freshly ground pepper, to taste
2 leeks, white and light green portions, rinsed well and thinly sliced
1 Tbs. finely chopped fresh flat leaf parsley
directions: In deep half of frittata pan over medium high heat melt 1 Tbs. butter. Add potatoes, salt and pepper. Cover with shallow pan; cook, flipping potatoes occasionally, about 8 minutes. Transfer to bowl.
In deep half of frittata pan over medium heat, melt 1 Tbs. butter. Add leeks, salt and pepper. Cook, stirring occasionally, 6-8 minutes. Transfer to separate bowl.

In another bowl, whisk eggs and cream. Stir in cheese, parsley, potatoes, salt, pepper and all but 2 Tbs. leeks. Set deep half of frittata pan over medium high heat, melt 1/2 Tbs. butter. Add egg mixture, cook until just beginning to set, about 4 minutes, using rubber spatula to lift cooked edges and allow uncooked eggs to flow underneath.

In shallow half of frittata pan over medium heat, melt 1/2 Tbs. butter. Place shallow pan upside down on top of deep pan, flip frittata into shallow pan. Cook, covered, 4 minutes. Remove deep pan; cook until eggs are set 2-3 minutes. Shake pan to loosen frittata; slide onto plate. Garnish with reserved leeks. Serves 4-6.

title: Lion House Orange Rolls
ingredients: 1 recipe dough for Lion House Dinner Rolls (see recipe)
2 to 4 Tbs heavy cream or 2 Tbs half and half
directions: __SECTION__Rolls

After dough for Lion House Dinner Rolls has risen the first time, roll dough to rectangle 1/4 inch thick. Combine melted butter and orange zest in a small bowl; brush over dough. Sprinkle with sugar. With pizza cutter or very sharp knife, cut dough in half to make two strips about 4 inches wide. make cuts through strips of dough every 2 inches, making about 18 pieces of dough. Roll up strips, starting with narrow edge. Place on lightly greased baking sheet. Allow to rise until double in size, about 40 minutes. Bake at 375 degrees for 12 to 15 minutes, until light golden brown. Remove from oven and brush with melted butter. Allow to cool about 10 to 15 minutes, drizzle with Orange Icing.

title: Lion Housse Dinner Rolls
ingredients: 2/3 cup nonfat dry milk (instant or non instant)
5 to 5 1/2 cups all purpose flour or bread flour
directions: In a large bowl or electric mixer, combine water and milk powder’ stir until milk dissolves. Add yeast, then sugar, salt, butter, egg, and 2 cups of flour. Mix on low speed until ingredients are wet, then for 2 minutes at medium speed. Add 2 cups flour; mix on low speed until ingredients are wet, then for 2 minutes at medium speed. Dough will be getting stiff and remaining flour may need to be mixed by hand. Add about 1/2 cup flour and mix again, by hand or mixer. Dough should be soft, not overly sticky, and not stiff. It is not necessary to use the entire amount of flour.

Scrape dough off sides of bowl and pour about one tablespoon of vegetable oil all around sides of bowl. Turn dough over in bowl so it is covered with oil. This helps prevent dough from drying out. Cover with plastic and allow to rise in warm place until double in size. Sprinkle cutting board or counter with flour and place dough on floured board. Roll out and cut rolls into desired shape and size. Place on greased or parchment lined baking pans. let rise in warm place until rolls are double in size (about 1 - 1 1/2 hours). Bake at 375 for 12 to 15 minutes, until lightly golden brown. See Orange Roll recipe if desired.

title: Magic Cookie Bars
directions: In 13x9 pan melt margarine and then sprinkle graham cracker crumbs and pat down to form crust. Pour milk over evenly. Top with remaining ingredients. Bake for 20-25 minutes at 350.

title: Mamas Asian Chicken
ingredients: 1 1/2 pounds skinless, boneless chicken breast halves, cubed
directions: In a bowl, stir together warm water, brown sugar, orange juice, soy sauce, ketchup, white vinegar, garlic, red pepper flakes, five-spice powder, and orange peel until the sugar has dissolved and the mixture is well combined.

Heat the olive oil in a large skillet or wok over medium heat, and cook and stir the chicken until the outside is golden brown and the inside is no longer pink, 10 to 12 minutes. Pour the sauce mixture over the chicken, bring to a boil, reduce heat to medium-low, and cover the skillet. Simmer for 30 minutes, stirring occasionally.

While the chicken and sauce are simmering, bring the rice and water to a boil in a saucepan over high heat. Reduce heat to medium-low, cover, and simmer until the rice is tender, and the liquid has been absorbed, 20 to 25 minutes. Set the rice aside and keep warm.

Whisk the cornstarch and 2 tablespoons of cold water in a small bowl until smooth, and stir into the chicken and sauce, a few teaspoons at a time. Let the chicken and sauce cook for about 2 minutes to thicken, then serve over hot cooked rice, sprinkled with green onion.

title: Mango Macadamia Crisp
ingredients: 4 cups chopped peeled ripe mango (or frozen mango)
directions: Preheat oven to 400 degrees.

Combine 1/4 cup granulated sugar and cornstarch, stirring well with whisk. Add mango, lime juice and 2 tsp melted butter and toss gently to combine. Place mango mixture in an 8 inch square baking dish coated with cooking spray.

To prepare topping lightly spoon flour into a dry measure cup, level with knife. Combine flour, 3 Tbs of granulated sugar, brown sugar, and ginger, stirring well. Cut in 3 Tbs. butter with a pastry blender or 2 knives until mixture resembles coarse meal. Stir in nuts. Sprinkle flour mixture evenly over mango mixture. Bake at 400 for 40 minutes or until browned.

title: Mango Salsa
ingredients: 1 mango, peeled, seeded and coarsely chopped
1/2 jalapeno chile, seeded and finely diced
1/4 cup lightly packed, chopped fresh cilantro
directions: Combine ingredients and serve with chips.

title: Marinated Vegetables
directions: Combine sugar, mustard, salt, vinegar, oil, onion and poppy seed. Blend well. Add vegetables and coat well. Marinade and chill at least 2 hours. Drain and serve. Half the dressing recipe is enough unless you chop twice as many veggies.

title: Minestrone Soup
directions: Saute sausage (out of casing, crumbled) with garlic, onion, pepper.
Mix all ingredients. Simmer to tender. Serve sprinkled with grated Parmesan cheese.

title: Miniature Cupcakes
directions: Mix flour, sugar, cocoa, soda and salt. Add remaining ingredients and mix well. Fill miniature cupcakes tins and drip a tsp of topping with 1 chocolate chip in topping. Bake at 350 fro 15-18 minutes.

title: Mint Chocolate Chip Ice Cream Cake
ingredients: 1 Devils Food pudding in the mix cake mix
1/2 gallon mint chocolate chip ice cream
directions: Soften ice cream. Line a 9" layer cake pan with saran wrap and put soften ice cream into pan. Put in the freezer until firm.
Prepare and bak cake as directed on box an bake in 2 cake pans. Let cool completely.
Layer 1 cake, ice cream then second cake.
Frost with cool whip mixed with cocoa. Freeze in covered cake container until time to serve.

title: Monkey Bread
directions: Quarter biscuits and shake them in a bag with 3/4 cup sugar and cinnamon. Put biscuits in well greased angel food cake or Bundt pan. Bring remaining 1 cup sugar and butter to a boil and pour over biscuit pieces. Bake at 350 degrees for 45 minutes. Remove from pan immediately. Serve when cool by pulling apart pieces to eat.

title: Mounds Bars
directions: Combine graham crackers, butter and sugar. Spread in a 9x13 pan and bake for 10 minutes at 305 degrees.
Combine coconut and milk. Spread over crust and bake for 15 minutes.
Combine chocolate chips and peanut butter. Melt and spread over coconut layer. Refrigerate/freeze before serving.

title: Mrs. Field’s Chocolate Chip Cookies
directions: Cream together butter and sugar. Add eggs and vanilla. Add dry ingredients. Bake 10 minutes at 350 degrees.

title: Muffins
directions: Mix all ingredients together and bake at 400.
May roll in butter and cinnamon and sugar after baking or add berries to batter before baking.

title: Neiman Marcus Cookies
directions: Cream butter and sugars. Add eggs and vanilla. Mix together with flour, salt, oatmeal, baking powder and soda. (measure oatmeal and then blend into a fine powder) Add chocolate chips, hershey’s bar and nuts. Roll into balls. Bake 10 minutes at 375.

title: Nestle Toll House Pan Cookies
directions: Preheat oven to 375 degrees. Combine flour, baking soda and salt; set aside. Combine butter, sugar, brown sugar, and vanilla; beat until creamy. Beat in eggs. Gradually add flour mixture and stir in chocolate chips and nuts. Spread into greased 15x10 pan and bake 20 minutes at 375. Makes 35 squares. Or half recipe, bake in 9x13 pan for 12-15 minutes for 24 squares.

title: New England Pot Roast
ingredients: 8 medium carrots, halved crosswise and lengthwise
directions: __SECTION__Meat
Stir together flour, salt and pepper. Rub mixture on meat thoroughly. Melt shortening in a large skillet or Dutch Oven; brown meat over medium heat, about 15 minutes.
Reduce heat; spread horseradish on both sides of meat. Add water; cover tightly and simmer on top of range or in 325 degree oven for 4 hours or until meat is tender.
About 1 hour before end of cooking time, add vegetables and 1/2 tsp salt. Place meat and vegetables on warm platter; keep warm while making gravy. Serve gravy with meat and vegetables.

title: No Bake Cookies
directions: put sugar and milk in med saucepan and bring to a boil, let boil for 1 min.
add butter and vanila. pour in to oatmeal mix and mix well. Drop by spoonful on to waxpaper, let harden
while cooking mix oatmeal, cocoa and coconut in large bowl.
lay out wax paper to drop cookies on.

title: Old Fashion Chewy Molasses Cookies
directions: Mix together shortening, sugar, molasses and egg. Add baking soda, flour and spices. Roll in 1 inch balls, roll in granulated sugar. Bake at 375 degrees for 8 to 10 minutes (no longer, that’s the secret for chewy cookies).

title: Orange Butter Cookies
ingredients: 16 Tbs (2 sticks) unsalted butter, at room temperature
1/2 cup semisweet chocolate chips, preferably miniature
directions: Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Line 2 baking sheets with aluminum foil or parchment paper.

In a large bowl, with an electric mixer on medium speed, beat the butter, salt and sugar until smooth. Add the egg yolks, vanilla, and almond extracts and orange zest and mix until incorporated. Reduce the speed to low and gradually add the flour, mixing just until thoroughly incorporated. using a wooden spoon, stir in the chocolate chips.

Roll a scant tablespoon of dough between the palms of your hands, shape it into a ball and place on the prepared baking sheet. Repeat with the remaining dough, spacing them about 2 inches apart. Using the bottom of a glass dipped in water, flatten each ball into a circle. The flattened cookies should be about 1 inch apart.

Bake the cookies until the edges are lightly golden but not browned, 15 to 18 minutes. Reverse the baking sheets after 10 minutes from front to back and top to bottom to ensure that the cookies bake evenly. Transfer the sheets to a wire rack to cool for about 2 minutes, then transfer the cookies to a wire rack to cool completely.

title: Orange Julius
directions: Combine ingredients in blender. Serve immediately.

title: Outrageous Chocolate Pecan Pie
ingredients: 1 package (4oz) German chocolate, melted and cooled (can also use semis sweet baby chocolate chips)
directions: In a large bowl stir eggs, corn syrup, chocolate, sugar, butter and vanilla until blended. Stir in pecans. Pour into pie shell. Bake at 350 for 50 to 60 minutes or until knife comes out clean. Serve with whipped cream.

title: Pat Miller’s Spaghetti and Meatballs
directions: Blend tomatoes and then combine all ingredients. Cook about 4 to 5 hours. I usually keep it covered until the last hour. Sauce will thicken the longer it is uncovered. Freezes well.

title: Paul’s Pumpkin Bars
directions: In a bowl stir together flour, baking powder, cinnamon, baking soda, and salt. Set aside.
In a large mixing bowl, beat together eggs, pumpkin, sugar and oil with an electric mixer. Add the flour mixture. Beat until well combined. If desired, add chopped pecans.
Spread batter into an ungreased 15x10x1 baking pan. Bake at 350 for 25-20 minutes. Cool and frost. If desired top with additional pecan halves. Cut into squares. Store in refrigerator.

title: Peach Cobbler
directions: Combine peaches and 1 cup sugar. Set aside and let stand for 30 minutes.
Melt margarine in 9x13 glass pan.
Combine all remaining ingredients. Mix until lumps gone and pour over margarine.
Bake at 325 for 50-60 minutes.

title: Peanut Blossoms
directions: Cream together butter and peanut butter. Add sugars, egg, and vanilla and beat well. Add flour, baking soda, and salt. Shape into balls and roll in sugar. Bake on greased cookie sheet for 8 minutes at 375. Top with hershey kiss and return to oven for 3-5 minutes.

title: Peanut Butter Cookies
directions: Mix shortening, peanut butter, sugar and egg with mixer. Add dry ingredients. Chill dough in fridge for 2 hours. Spoon onto sheet and criss cross with fork. Bake 10-12 minutes at 375.

title: Pepper Crusted Beef Tenderloin with Horseradish Sauce
ingredients: 3 Tbs minced fresh flat leaf parsley
directions: Preheat oven to 400

Trim fat from tenderloin, fold under 3 inches of small end. Rub with olive oil. Combine the breadcrumbs, parley, pepper, and 1/2 tsp salt. Rub with crumb mixture, coat with cooking spray. Place on the rack of a broiler pan or roasting pan. Insert a meat thermometer into the thickest portion of tenderloin. Bake at 400 for 30 minutes. Increased oven temperature to 425 and bake for an additional 10 minutes or until thermometer registers 140 to 155. Place the tenderloin on a platter and cover with foil. Let stand 10 minutes for tenderloin to reabsorb juices.
Combine 1/4 tsp salt, the sour cream and the remaining ingredients in a small bowl. Serve with the beef.

title: Pesto
directions: Grind basil, salt, garlic, and pine nuts in food processor. Place in bowl and add cheese. Slowly whisk in olive oil. COntinue to whisk until a mayonnaise like texture is obtained. Add more of each ingredient as needed.

title: Poppy Seed Bread
directions: Blend all ingredients except poppy seeds. Beat for 2 minutes. Add poppy seeds last. Bake for 1 hour at 350 degrees.

title: Pork Roast
directions: Place roast on rack in a shallow roasting pan. Bake uncovered at 350 for 1 to 1 1/2 hours. In a saucepan combine the apple jelly, apple juice, and cardamon. Cook and stir over medium heat until smooth and heated through. Set aside 1/2 cup. Brush some of the remaining sauce over the roast and bake 40 to 60 minutes longer or until meat thermometer reads 160-170 brushing with sauce every 20 minutes. Transfer roast to a serving platter and keep warm. Pour pan drippings into a saucepan. Add apricots and reserved fruit sauce. Cook over medium heat until mixture boils, about 2 minutes. Serve with roast.

title: Potato Casserole
directions: Boil potatoes in jacket. Peel while warm. Cool and grate. Heat soup and butter. Blend in sour cream, onions, and cheese. Mix in potatoes. Put mixture into a 2 1/2 quart casserole. Sprinkle with 3/4 cup corn flakes or cracker crumbs. Bake 45 minutes to 1 hour in 350 degree oven

title: Pumpkin Bread
directions: Mix oil, egg, and water. Add pumpkin and stir. Add dry ingredients and mix well. Pour into pan and cook 40 minutes at 350.

title: Pumpkin Cheesecake
ingredients: 1 (14 oz) can sweet and condensed milk
directions: __SECTION__Maple Pecan Glaze
Preheat oven to 325 degrees.
Combine graham cracker crumbs, sugar, butter; press firmly on bottom of 9 inch spring form pan.
With mixer, beat cream cheese until fluffy. Gradually beat in milk until smooth. Add pumpkin, eggs, syrup, cinnamon, nutmeg and salt; mix well. Pour into prepared pan.
Bake 1 1/4 hours or until center appears nearly set when shaken. Cool 1 hour. Cover and chill at least 4 hours.
To serve spoon some Maple Pecan Sauce over cheesecake. Garnish with whipped cream and pecans (optional). Pass remaining sauce. Store leftovers in refrigerator.

title: Pumpkin Soup
directions: Melt butter. Cook onion until tender. Add 1 can of broth and boil. Reduce heat and simmer. Put in blender and process. Return to pan. Add broth, pumpkin and next 5 ingredients and boil Simmer 10 minutes. Add half and half. Makes 7 cups.

title: Quiche
directions: Cook bacon and crumble on the bottom of pie shell. In large bowl mix other ingredients and pour into pie shell. Heat oven to 450, then turn to 400 and bake quiche for 12 minutes. Turn over to 325 and cook for another 20-30 minutes.

title: Raspberry Cheese Spread
directions: Combine all thoroughly and press into a form lined with plastic wrap. Refrigerate overnight and then empty out on a plate and cover with raspberry preserves. Serve with crackers.

title: Raspberry Kielbasa over Cheese Grits
ingredients: 1 (16 ounce) package kielbasa sausage, sliced into 1/2 inch pieces
directions: In a saucepan, combine the water and milk. Bring to boil, then stir in the grits, reduce the heat to low, and simmer until thick, about 10 minutes. Stir in the cheese, and remove from the heat.

Heat the olive oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Add the sausage, mushrooms and onion; cook and stir until browned. Stir in the preserves, and simmer until sausage and mushrooms are coated and sauce is smooth, about 5 minutes. Serve over cheese grits.

title: Red Devils Food Cake
directions: __SECTION__Cake

Cream shortening and sugar. Add eggs and vanilla. Make paste with food coloring and cocoa. Add to egg/sugar mixture. Add flour and salt alternating with buttermilk. Finally add soda mixed with vanilla. Bake at 350 degrees for 25-30 minutes in a 9x13 pan.

title: Red Pepper Hummus
ingredients: 15 oz can of chickpeas, washed and drained
directions: Put chickpeas in blender and puree. Put Tahini paste and water in bowl and mix until smooth.
Add paste and garlic to chickpeas and process until smooth.
Add olive oil and lemon in alternate streams with motor running.
Season with salt and pepper.

title: Red Pepper Jelly Brie Bites
ingredients: 2 (1.9 oz) packages frozen mini phyllo pastry shells
3 oz brie cheese, rind removed cut into 30 very small pieces
directions: Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Place mini phyllo pastry shells, thawed, on a baking sheet. Spoon rounded 1/4 tsp red pepper jelly into each shell; top with cheese. Sprinkle with roasted salted almonds. Bake tartlets 5 to 6 minutes or until cheese is melted.

title: Rich Yeast Dough
ingredients: 2 packages active dry yeast or 2 cakes compressed yeast
directions: __SECTION__Dough

Put sugar and salt into large mixing bowl. Dissolve yeast in water. Beat 2 cups flour into cooled milk until smooth. (I usually put the butter into the pan with the milk and heat them together.) Add eggs, one at a time and beat, beat, beat. Work in the additional flour, one cup at a time, beating well. After adding the 6th cup, I put about 1/2 cup flour on the pastry cloth or breadboard and place the dough on it, covering with the same bowl and let stand for about 10 minutes. Scrape the bowl and wash. Knead your dough, adding flour as you go along, about 10 minutes or until dough is smooth and elastic. Grease the bowl, put dough in. Cover with saran wrap and let rise until doubled in bulk. Divide dough into fourths and shape as you wish. You can also wrap each fourth in saran wrap and then in a plastic baggie and place in refrigerator, will keep for up to one week in refrigerator.

title: Ricotta Cheese Cookies
directions: Blend eggs, sugar, butter and ricotta cheese. Then add remaining ingredients. Drop by spoon on ungreased cookie sheet. Bake 8-10 minutes at 350 until slightly brown on edges. Frost with mixture of 1 box powdered sugar, 1 tsp vanilla, 2 tbsp melted butter and milk until spreadable.

title: Risotto with Asiago
ingredients: 6 to 8 cups homemade or low sodium canned chicken broth
directions: Bring stock to a boil in a medium saucepan over medium heat; reduce heat and keep at a low simmer.

Meanwhile, heat oil in a large heavy bottom saucepan over medium heat. Add shallots and cook, stirring frequently, until they are softened and translucent, about 4 minutes. Add rice; cook, stirring frequently, until it is thoroughly coated and slightly fragrant, 3 to 4 minutes. Add wine and cook, stirring constantly, until it is completely absorbed.
Using a ladle, add 3/4 cup hot chicken stock to rice mixture; stir constantly with a wooden spoon until it is thick enough to leave a clear wake behind the spoon.

Continue adding stock 3/4 cup at a time stirring constantly after each addition until rice is mostly translucent but still opaque in the center and liquid is the consistency of heavy cream, a total of 18 to 20 minutes. The mixture will continue to thicken slightly when removed from heat. Remove from heat and add butter and cheese.

title: Roasted Tomato Salad
ingredients: 2 large or 4 small cloves of garlic, finely chopped or crushed
Salt and freshly milled black pepper
directions: Preheat oven to 400F. Cut each tomato in half and place in shallow roasting dish. Season with salt and pepper. Sprinkle on the chopped garlic, distributing evenly between the tomatoes. Follow this with a few droplets of olive oil on each one. Top each one with a basil leaf, turning leaf over to get a coating of oil. Place the baking dish in the top half of the oven and roast the tomatoes for 50 minutes or until the edges are slightly blackened. Remove from oven and discard the burnt basil leaves. Pour dressing over the tomatoes while they are still warm and baste with the juices in the dish Place fresh basil leaves on tomatoes and garnish with black olives.

title: Roasted Vegetables
directions: Cube the vegetables. Drizzle olive oil over top, season with sea salt and coarse ground pepper. Toss all ingredients together to coat. Bake at 350 for 40 minutes.

title: Rolls
directions: Mix flour, powdered milk, 1/4 cup sugar, and salt.
Add 2 cups warm water, eggs, and oil.
Mix 1 cup sugar, 1/2 cup warm water and yeast and then add to previous mixture.
Stir and knead.
Rise for 1 hour.
Roll and cut.
Rise for an additional hour.
Bake 10 minutes at 400.

title: Scrambled Egg Casserole
ingredients: 2 cups soft bread crumbs, cut off crusts and save
directions: Soak bread crumbs in milk. Beat eggs lightly and cook in butter, adding salt and pepper to taste. Add bread crumbs. Pour into flat baking dish (9x9 pan). Top with Swiss cheese. Brown 1/2 cup bread crusts in 2 Tbs. butter and spread on top of cheese. Top with sausage. Bake at 400 degrees for 20 minutes.

title: Secondi Piatti Chicken Marsala
directions: Place porcini mushrooms in a small bowl. Cover with 1/2 cup warm water. Allow to soak for 20 minutes, until mushrooms are tender. Slice mushrooms into thin strips.
Put chicken breasts between two sheets of plastic wrap. With a heavy meat mallet or pan, pound chicken breasts thin.
Heat pan on stove. Add olive oil and butter. In a small bowl, combine flour, salt and pepper.

Dredge chicken breast in flour mixture and add to pan. Saute briefly , about 2 minutes on each side. Add mushrooms, saute another 20 seconds or so. Add Marsala wine, de-glaze pan and burn off the alcohol. Add chicken stock and mushroom soaking liquid. Continue to heat until sauce thickens slightly.
Remove from stove, sprinkle lemon juice on top. Parsley and lemon may be used to garnish.

title: Sesame Noodles
ingredients: 1/3 pound thin spaghetti, cooked al dente, drained and cooled
directions: Whisk peanut butter, soy sauce, cayenne pepper, and oils together. Add noodles and toss to coat. Sprinkle with sesame seeds and scallions to garnish.

title: Snicker Brownies
ingredients: 1 pkg german chocolate cake mix (duncan hines)
directions: Unwrap carmels and place in sauce pan with 1/3 cup evaporated milk.
Cook carmels over low heat, stirring constantly, until candy has melted. Set aside.
In mixing bowl, combine cake mix, remaining evaporated milk, melted butter, and nuts.
Press 1/2 cake mix into greased and flowered 9x13 pan (mixture will be doughy). Bake for 6 minutes on 350.
Remove pan from oven and sprinkle chocolate chips over cake mixture, pour carmel mixture over chocolate, then crumble remaining cake mixture over the top.
Return to oven and bake 15-20 minutes.
Remove from oven and cool for about 15 minutes.
Refrigerate for 30 minutes to set carmel. Cut into squares and serve.

title: Sour Cream Enchiladas
directions: Cook chicken and dice. Mix chicken with sour cream, soup, and chilies. Spread enough chicken mixture on the bottom of a 9x13 pan to cover the bottom. Spoon chicken mixture onto tortilla, top with cheese, roll and place in baking dish. Repeat and fill pan. Top with remaining chicken mixture. Sprinkle with cheese. Cover with foil Bake for 30 minutes at 350

title: Southern Chocolate Mint Brownies
directions: Beat eggs lightly with wire whisk. Add sugar and stir well.
Combine flour and cocoa. Gradually stir into egg mixture.
Stir in 1 cup melted butter, salt and vanilla.
Pour into greased 15x10x1 jelly roll pan. Bake for 15 to 18 minutes. Cool.
Spread mint cream frosting and freeze 15 minutes.
Melt 1 cup semi sweet chocolate chips and 6 TBSP margarine. When smooth, spread a thin layer over the mint frosting.
Chill until firm and cut into small squares. Store in fridge.

title: Southwest Salsa
directions: Make dressing according to package. Drain peas and corn. Juice to limes. Chop avocados and tomatoes. Add all ingredients in large bowl. May add a small amount of green onion and cilantro. Refrigerate and serve with tortilla chips.

title: Spinach and Artichoke Dip
ingredients: 1 pkg light or regular cream cheese
1 can Progresso artichoke hearts, chopped small
1/3 cup regular or light sour cream
directions: Simmer onion in olive oil and 1 tsp butter. Warm cream cheese in microwave at half power for about 1 minute until warm. Mix ingredients together. Microwave at half power until very warm.

title: Spinach and Pasta Salad
ingredients: 1 16oz box of bow tie pasta (boil with some salt)
2 cups cooked chicken diced (i always use more and I boil chicken breasts with a few cloves of garlic and salt)
1 cup teriyaki sauce (the thick kind works best)
directions: Combine all dressing ingredients in large bowl then marinate cooked pasta, chicken and green onions in dressing for 2 to 3 hours in the fridge. After marinating add all additional ingredients.

title: Strawberry Smoothies
directions: Blend until smooth. Serve in chilled glasses and garnish with lime.

title: Sweet Potatoe Casserole
directions: Boil sweet potatoes until soft. Drain and peel once cooled enough to handle. Mix all ingredients together until smooth and fluffy. Put in a baking dish. Add topping and bake for 30 minutes at 350 or until bubbly.

title: Taquitos
ingredients: Small yellow or white corn tortillas
directions: Heat over to 425. Line baking sheet with foil and spray lightly with nonstick cooking spray.
Mix cream cheese, salsa, lime juice, cumin, chili powder, onion powder, garlic powder, cilantro, green onion. Add chicken and 1 cup of cheese.

Warm up tortillas between damp paper towels in microwave. Add mixture and roll up. Use toothpick if necessary to keep closed. Place seam side down, make sure they don’t touch each other. Spray tops lightly with cooking spray and lightly sprinkle with salt.
Bake 15-20 minutes or until crisp and ends are golden brown. Remove and top with remaining cheese. Server with sour cream, salsa, and guacamole.

title: Texas Sheet Cake
directions: Mix sugar, flour, and salt. Boil the butter, water, and cocoa. Next add the sour cream, eggs, ad soda to the butter mixture. Mix and add to flour mixture. Batter will be hot and thin. Pour into greased 10 1/2 by 15 pan. Bake 20 to 25 minutes at 375.

title: Tortellini Salad
ingredients: 1 to 1.5 lbs of cooked, drained and rinsed tortellini
directions: Slice veggies and add to pasta. Toss with dressing ingredients. Chill and serve.

title: Tortilla Crusted Pork
ingredients: 1/2 cup finely crushed blue corn tortilla chips
3 Tbs extra virgin olive oil, divided
1 Serrano or jalapeno pepper, seeded and finely chopped
1 jalapeno pepper, seeded and finely chopped
directions: __SECTION__Pork

Remove silver skin from tenderloin, leaving a think layer of fat covering tenderloin. Cut into 1 inch thick medallions. Combine blue corn tortilla chips and next five ingredients in a bowl. Brush pork with 1 1/2 Tbs olive oil and dredge in tortilla chip mixture, pressing mixture into medallions on all sides to coat. Cook pork medallions in remaining 1 1/2 Tbs hot oil in a large skillet over medium heat 6 minutes on each side or until done. Serve with salsas. Garnish if desired.

title: Tortilla Wrap Ups
directions: Mix cream cheese, olives, chilies, almonds, and pimento. Spread on tortillas, roll them up and slice. Can be rolled and wrapped in saran wrap and cut when ready to serve.

title: Vegetable Dip
directions: Blend cream cheese and soup mix. Drain spinach thoroughly and add to mix. Serve with veggies.

title: Velveeta Chicken Casserole
ingredients: 3/4 pkg spaghetti, boiled in chicken broth
directions: Mix chicken and spaghetti with sauce. heat at 350 until hot.

title: Waffles
directions: Mix ingredients together. Cook waffles and serve with syrup or fruit and whip cream.

title: Wassail
directions: Put all ingredients in a large pot and bring to a boil. Then simmer for 3 to 4 hours and add more allspice and sugar to taste. You can make this the day before and then heat up and serve. I have even saved it for a week and served it. When I save it I strain it and refrigerate it.

title: White Bread
directions: Dissolve yeast in 3/4 cups warm water. Stir in 2 2/3 cups warm water, the sugar, salt, shortening and 5 cups flour. Beat until smooth. Mix in enough remaining flour to make dough easy to handle.

Turn dough onto lightly floured board; knead until smooth and elastic, about 10 minutes. Place in greased bowl; turn greased side up. Cover; let rise in warm place until double, about 1 hour. Dough is ready if impression remains.

Punch down dough; divide in half. Roll each half into rectangle, 18x9 inches. Roll up, beginning at short side. With side of hand, press each end to seal. Fold ends under loaf. Place seam side down in greased loaf pan, 9x5x3 inches. Brush loaves lightly with butter. Let us rise until double, about 1 hour.

Heat oven to 425 degrees. Place loaves on low rack so that tops of pans are in center of oven. Pans should not touch each other or sides of oven. Bake 30 to 35 minutes or until deep golden brown and loaves sound hollow when tapped. Remove from pans. Brush loaves with soft butter; cool on wire rack. Makes 2 loaves.

title: White Chicken Chili
ingredients: 1/2 C corn starch mixed with 1 cup cold water
directions: Put everything in the crock pot including uncooked chicken. Cook on high for 5 hours. Serve with cornbread.

title: Wonderful Fruit Dip
ingredients: 6 macaroon cookies, the soft kind, crumbled (or 12 mini cookies)
directions: In a small bowl, mix sour cream, brown sugar and cookies. Cover and refrigerate. Serve with fresh fruit plate.

title: Yummy Marshmallow Brownies
ingredients: Miniature marshmallows (add on top after baking but prior to frosting)
directions: Blend ingredients together, adding eggs one at a time. Spread on greased cookie sheet (15 1/2 x 10 1/2). Bake at 325 degrees for 25 minutes. Cover top of brownies with miniature marshmallows (appx. 8 ounces) and bake 3 minutes longer. Let cool then frost.
****Let stand overnight or several hours before cutting to serve.

title: Zesty Italian Crockpot Chicken
ingredients: 1 pkg. (8 oz.) cream cheese (let sit out to soften)
1 pkg. italian dressing seasoning (the dried kind in the packet)
directions: stir the cream cheese, cream of chicken, and seasoning together in the crockpot. i actually start it on low and let them sit in there for about 30 min so the cream cheese is softer to stir. (but don’t forget about them like i did today!) put the frozen (because i’m lazy) chicken in and cover with the mix. cook on high 4-6 hours or until the chicken is cooked and fall-apart-tender. after the first two hours when the chicken is softer i cut it up into strips for easier eating. how easy is that!?
cook the rice in a pot (or rice cooker if you’re not dumb like me and know how to use the stupid thing) and smother with chicken mixture! the italian seasoning is the secret ingredient! so yum!
